attributes.action: Improve home-school transport in Bath & North East Somerset.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Secondary school children in B&NES travelling to school face:  
• Overcrowding 
• Being stranded as there isn’t enough space on the bus.
• Sustaining injury (one incident Sept-Oct 2007).
• Buses arriving late, early or not at all
• Being left at school for more than 1 hour.
• Having to use several buses on each journey, significantly increasing the cost of travel.
• Slow buses 
• Buses frequently arrive at school late, resulting in being marked absent.
• Overpriced fares 
• Parents pay more than £500 per year per child  
• There is no child-rate travel-card or season ticket available in Bath.
• Many parents drive out of desperation at the situation. 
• Congestion & pollution faces everyone in Bath
• A real solution to the home-school transport issue would make a significant difference to everyone in Bath, not just parents and children
We therefore call on B&NES Council to:
1. Ensure that every secondary school child has a seat on a suitable bus.
2. Re-establish home-school transport as a high priority in the council’s budget.
3. Ensure that home-school transport is more:
a. reliable, 
b. safe,
c. affordable.
